inlineContent.text: Firebase has two ways to create and deploy cloud functions: HTTPS functions and callable functions. HTTPS functions are invoked via HTTP requests, while callable functions are easier to use from client-side applications using client SDKs with built-in security features. HTTPS functions offer more flexibility and can be invoked from a wider range of clients, including non-Firebase clients, but developers must implement their own security measures.

abstract.text: Now, you want to send a weekly email reminder to your users with their articles of the week. This is a common use case that can be easily achieved with Firebase Cloud Functions. Firebase Cloud Functions provide a simple yet powerful way to set up email extensions for your application, allowing you to send emails programmatically. In this chapter, you will guide you through the process of setting up email extensions for Firebase Cloud Functions and demonstrate how to create a Pub/Sub function to trigger email notifications. By the end of this chapter, you will have a working understanding of how to leverage Firebase Cloud Functions to send emails and create Pub/Sub functions. So let‚Äôs dive in and learn how to set up email extensions for Firebase Cloud Functions!
